name: bandwidth
pos: noun [ C usually singular or U ]
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: bandwidth
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a measurement of the amount of information that can be sent between computers, through a phone line, etc.

example.eg: The system will handle signals that need high bandwidth, for instance those that encode TV pictures.
example.egtrans: 这个系统可以处理需要高带宽的信号，比如编码压缩过的电视图像信号。

trans_examp.trans_en: the ability or time to deal with a situation, especially one that involves a large amount of information or a number of problems
trans_examp.trans_cn: 处理大信息或复杂情况所需的时间、精力和综合能力

example.eg: I don't have the bandwidth to read stuff I know isn't going to lead to productive discussion.
example.egtrans: 我没有精力去看那种没什么正面意义的东西。

example.eg: If people misreport or misrepresent my arguments, I am using more of my bandwidth to correct the misreporting.
example.egtrans: 如果我的论点被误传或歪曲了，那我会花多一点精力去加以纠正。

dsense.name: bandwidth
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the range of frequencies used to send information over a distance using phone wires
in radio, the width of a particular waveband
